arabicText: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Except	our	earlier	death,	and	nor	will	we	
be	punished?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	hamāri	pahli	maut	aur	ham	par	
‘aƶāb	na	hogā.

englishTranslationText:
“This	is,	most	certainly,	the	supreme	
success.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	yahi	badi	kāmyābi	hai.

englishTranslationText:
For	such	a	reward	should	the	workers	
perform.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aisi	hi	bāt	ke	liye	kāmiyoñ	ko	kām	karnā	
chāhiye.

arabicText: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌۭ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
englishTranslationText:
So	is	this	welcome	better,	or	the	tree	of	
Zaqqum?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	ye	mehmāni	bhali	yā	thohad	kā	perd.

englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	made	that	a	punishment	
for	the	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	ne	usey	zālimoñ	ki	jāñch	kiyā		
hai.

arabicText: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌۭ تَخْرُجُ فِىٓ أَصْلِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	it	is	a	tree	that	sprouts	from	the	base	of	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	woh	aik	perd	hai	ke	Jahannam	ki	
jad	meiñ	nikaltā	hai.

englishTranslationText: Its	fruit	like	the	heads	of	demons.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	kā	shagoofa	jaise	dewoñ	ke	sar.

arabicText: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَـَٔاكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنْهَا ٱلْبُطُونَ
englishTranslationText: So	indeed	they	will	eat	from	it,	and	fill	their	bellies	with	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	be-shak	woh	us	mein	se	khāyeñ	ge	phir	us	se	pet	bhareñ	ge.

arabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًۭا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Then	after	it,	indeed	for	them	is	the	drink	of	boiling	hot	water.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	be-shak	un	ke	liye	us	par	khaulte	pāni	ki	miloni	(milāwat)	hai.

englishTranslationText: Then	surely	their	return	is	towards	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	be-shak	un	ke	liye	us	par	khaulte	pāni	ki	miloni	(milāwat)	hai.

englishTranslationText: They	had	indeed	found	their	forefathers	astray.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	unhoñ	ne	apne	bāp	dada	gumrāh	pāye.

englishTranslationText: So	they	hastily	follow	their	footsteps!
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	unhiñ	ke	nishān-e-qadam	par	daurde	jāte	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	before	them,	most	of	the	former	people	went	astray.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	un	se	pahle	bahut	se	agle	gumrāh	huye.

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	We	had	sent	Heralds	of	warnings	among	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	un	meiñ	dar	sunāne	wāle	bheje.

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	We	had	sent	Heralds	of	warnings	among	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Therefore	see	what	sort	of	fate	befell	those	who	were	warned!

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	We	had	sent	Heralds	of	warnings	among	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	dekho	darāye	gayoñ	kā	kaisā	anjām	huā.

englishTranslationText: Except	the	chosen	bondmen	of	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	hameñ	Nūḥ	ne	pukārā	to	ham	kyā		hi	achchhe	qabool	farmāne	wāle.

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	Nooh	prayed	to	Us	–	so	what	an	excellent	Acceptor	of	Prayer	We	are!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ham	ne	usey	aur	us	ke	ghar	wāloñ	ko	badi	taklif	se	najāt	di.

englishTranslationText: And	We	rescued	him	and	his	household	from	the	great	calamity.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Ham	ne	usi	ki	aulād	bāqi	rakhi.

englishTranslationText: And	We	preserved	his	descendants.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	pichloñ	meiñ	us	ki	ta’rif	bāqi	
rakhi.

englishTranslationText:
And	We	kept	his	praise	among	the	latter	
generations.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	pichloñ	meiñ	us	ki	ta’rif	bāqi	
rakhi.

englishTranslationText:
Peace	be	upon	Nooh,	among	the	entire	
people.
romanUrduTranslationText: Nūḥ	par	salām	ho	jahān	wāloñ	meiñ.

englishTranslationText: This	is	how	We	reward	the	virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	aisā	hi	sila	dete	haiñ	nekoñ	
ko.

englishTranslationText:
He	is	indeed	one	of	Our	high	ranking,	
firmly	believing	bondmen.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	woh	hamāre	a’alā	darje	ke	kāmil
ul-imān	bandoñ	meiñ	hai.

englishTranslationText: We	then	drowned	the	others.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	ham	ne	doosroñ	ko	dubo	diyā.

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	Ibrahim	is	from	his	(Nooh’s)	
group.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	usi	ke	giroh	se	Ibrāhim	hai.

englishTranslationText:
When	he	came	to	his	Lord,	with	a	sound	
heart.	(Free	from	falsehood).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	ke	apne	Rab	ke	pās	ḥāzir	huā	ghair	se	
salāmat	dil	le	kar.

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	he	said	to	his	father	(paternal	uncle)	
and	his	people,	“What	do	you	worship?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	us	ne	apne	bāp	aur	apni	qaum	se	
farmāyā	tum	kyā	poojte	ho.

englishTranslationText:
When	he	said	to	his	father	(paternal	uncle)	
and	his	people,	“What	do	you	worship?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	buhtān	se	Allāh	ke	siwā	aur	khudā	
chāhte	ho.

englishTranslationText:
“So	what	do	you	assume	regarding	the	
Lord	Of	The	Creation?”	(That	He	will	not	
punish	you?)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	tumhārā	kyā	gumān	hai	Rabb-ul
‘āalamin	par.

englishTranslationText: He	then	shot	a	glance	at	the	stars.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	us	ne	aik	nigāh	sitāroñ	ko	dekhā.

englishTranslationText: He	then	said,	“I	feel	sick	(of	you)!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	kahā	mai	bimār	hone	wālā	hoñ.

englishTranslationText:
And	they	turned	their	backs	on	him	and	
went	away.	(The	pagans	thought	he	would	
transmit	the	disease).
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	us	par	pith	de	kar	phir	gaye.

arabicText: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	then	sneaked	upon	their	deities	and	
said,	“Do	you	not	eat?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	un	ke	khudāōñ	ki	ṭaraf	chup	kar	chalā	
to	kahā	kyā		tum	nahiñ	khāte

englishTranslationText:
“What	is	the	matter	with	you,	that	you	do	
not	say	anything?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumheñ	kyā		huā	ke	nahiñ	bolte?

englishTranslationText:
“What	is	the	matter	with	you,	that	you	do	
not	say	anything?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumheñ	kyā		huā	ke	nahiñ	bolte?

englishTranslationText:
He	then	began	striking	them	with	his	right	
hand,	unseen	by	the	people
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	logoñ	ki	nazar	bachā	kar	unheñ	dahine	hath	
se	mārne	lagā.

englishTranslationText: So	the	disbelievers	came	running	towards	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kāfir	us	ki	ṭaraf	jaldi	karte	āaye.

englishTranslationText: So	the	disbelievers	came	running	towards	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kāfir	us	ki	ṭaraf	jaldi	karte	āaye.

englishTranslationText: He	said,	“What!	You	worship	what	you	yourselves	have	sculpted?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Farmāyā	kyā		apne	hath	ke	tarāshoñ	ko	poojte	ho.

englishTranslationText: He	said,	“What!	You	worship	what	you	yourselves	have	sculpted?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Allāh	ne	tumheñ	paidā	kiyā		aur	tumhāre	a’amāl	ko.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ لَهُۥ بُنْيَـٰنًۭا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِى ٱلْجَحِيمِ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“Construct	a	building	(furnace)	for	him,	and	then	cast	him	in	the	blazing	fire!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole	is	ke	liye	aik	‘imārat	chuno	phir	usey	bhadakti	āag	meiñ	dāl	do.

englishTranslationText:
So	they	tried	to	execute	their	evil	scheme	upon	him	–	We	therefore	degraded	them.	(Allah	saved	
him,	by	commanding	the	fire	to	turn	cool).
romanUrduTranslationText: To	unhoñ	ne	us	par	dāōñ	chalnā	(fareb	karnā)	chāhā	ham	ne	unheñ	nichā	dekhāyā.

arabicText: وَقَالَ إِنِّى ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
englishTranslationText: And	he	said,	“Indeed	I	shall	go	to	my	Lord	Who	will	guide	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kahā	maiñ	apne	rab	ki	ṭaraf	jāne	wālā	hooñ	ab	woh	mujhe	rāh	de	gā.

englishTranslationText: “My	Lord!	Give	me	a	meritorious	child.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ilāhi	mujhe	lāiq	aulād	de.

englishTranslationText: We	therefore	gave	him	the	glad	tidings	of	an	intelligent	son.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	ham	ne	usey	khush-khabri	sunāyi	aik	‘aqalmand	ladke	ki.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعْىَ قَالَ يَـٰبُنَىَّ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ فِى ٱلْمَنَامِ أَنِّىٓ أَذْبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	he	became	capable	of	working	with	him,	Ibrahim	said,	“O	my	son,	I	dreamt	that	I	am	
sacrificing	you	-	therefore	now	consider	what	is	your	opinion”;	he	said,	“O	my	father!	Do	what	
you	are	commanded!	Allah	willing,	you	will	soon	find	me	patiently	enduring!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	woh	us	ke	sāth	kām	ke	qābil	ho	gayā	kahā	aey	mere	bete	maiñ	ne	khwāb	dekhā	ke	maiñ	tujhe	ƶabaḥ	
kartā	huñ	ab	tu	dekh	teri	kyā	rāye	hai	kahā	aey	mere	bāp	kijiye	jis	bāt	kā	āap	ko	ḥukm	hota	hai	Khudā	ne	
chāhā	to	qarib	hai	ke	āap	mujhe	sābir	pāyeñ	ge.

englishTranslationText:
Then	(remember)	when	they	both	
submitted	to	Allah’s	command,	and	
Ibrahim	lay	his	son	facing	downwards.	
(The	knife	did	not	hurt	Ismail)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	jab	un	donoñ	ne	Hamāre	ḥukm	par	
gardan	rakhi	aur	bāp	ne	bete	ko	māthe	ke	
bal	litāyā	us	waqt	kā	hāl	na	pooch.

englishTranslationText: And	We	called	out	to	him,	“O	Ibrahim!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	usey	nidā	farmāyi	ke	aey	
Ibrāhim!

arabicText: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ ٱلرُّءْيَآ ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“You	have	indeed	made	the	dream	come	
true”;	and	this	is	how	We	reward	the	
virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	tu	ne	khwāb	sach	kar	dikhāyi	Ham	
aisā	hi	sila	dete	haiñ	nekoñ	ko.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	this	was	a	clear	test.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	ye	raushan	jāñch	thi.	.

englishTranslationText:
And	We	rescued	him	in	exchange	of	a	great	
sacrifice.	(The sacrifice of Ibrahim and 
Ismail - peace be upon them – is 
commemorated every year on 10,11 and 12 
Zil Haj)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	aik	badā	ƶabiḥa	us	ke	sadqe	
meiñ	de	kar	usey	bachā	liyā.

englishTranslationText:
And	We	kept	his	praise	among	the	latter	
generations.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	pichloñ	meiñ	us	ki	tareef	bāqi	
rakhkhi.

englishTranslationText: Peace	be	upon	Ibrahim!
romanUrduTranslationText: Salām	ho	Ibrahim	par.

englishTranslationText: This	is	how	We	reward	the	virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ham	aisā	hi	sila	dete	haiñ	nekoñ	ko.

englishTranslationText: This	is	how	We	reward	the	virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ham	aisā	hi	sila	dete	haiñ	nekoñ	ko.

englishTranslationText:
He	is	indeed	one	of	Our	high	ranking,	
firmly	believing	bondmen.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	woh	Hamāre	a’alā	darje	ke	Kāmil
ul-Imān	bandoñ	meiñ	haiñ.

englishTranslationText:
And	We	gave	him	the	glad	tidings	of	Ishaq,	
a	Herald	of	the	Hidden,	from	among	those	
who	deserve	Our	proximity.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	usey	khush-khabri	di	Isḥāq	ki	
ke	ghaib	ki	khabreñ	batāne	wālā	hamāre	
qurb-e-khās	ke	sazāwāroñ	meiñ.

arabicText: وَبَـٰرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌۭ وَظَالِمٌۭ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ مُبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	sent	blessings	upon	him	and	
Ishaq;	and	among	their	descendants	-	
some	who	do	good	deeds,	and	some	who	
clearly	wrong	themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	barkat	utāri	us	par	aur	Isḥāq	
par	aur	un	ki	aulād	meiñ	koyi	achchā	kām	
karne	wālā	aur	koyi	apni	jān	par	sariḥ	zulm	
karne	wālā.
